channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Duckett leads England to classic defeat of India
item.description: Ben Duckett's magnificent 149 leads England to chase down 371 and beat India by five wickets in a thrilling final day of the first Test at Headingley.

item.title: Emotional Raducanu battles into Eastbourne second round
item.description: An emotional Emma Raducanu produces an impressive fightback to reach the Eastbourne second round and continue her Wimbledon preparations.

item.title: Cricket: Today at the Test
item.description: Day five highlights from the first Test match between England and India.

item.title: Scoring machine or freak season? What Mbeumo could bring to Man Utd
item.description: As Manchester United chase the signing of Brentford's Bryan Mbeumo, BBC Sport looks at what he could bring to Old Trafford.

item.title: England chase 371 to seal brilliant win against India in first Test
item.description: Ben Duckett hits 149 and Zak Crawley and Joe Root both make half-centuries as England produce a brilliant run chase on the final day to win the first Test against India at Headingley.

item.title: QPR head coach Cifuentes leaves club
item.description: Queens Park Rangers head coach Marti Cifuentes leaves the Championship club.

item.title: 'Ball bounces like a rabbit' - Luis Enrique on Club World Cup pitches
item.description: Paris St-Germain boss Luis Enrique compares the pitches at the Club World Cup to "an NBA court full of holes".

item.title: Dart misses match points in defeat by Wimbledon champion Krejcikova
item.description: A frustrated Harriet Dart misses two match points in a narrow loss to reigning Wimbledon champion Barbora Krejcikova at Eastbourne.

item.title: Farrell not considered for England tour despite Saracens return
item.description: Coach Steve Borthwick says he will allow Owen Farrell to settle back into life at Saracens this summer, rather than calling him up for an immediate return to England duty.

item.title: 'He's taken England over the line!' - Smith hits two sixes to seal win
item.description: Jamie Smith hits two sixes in three balls against Ravindra Jadeja to seal a five-wicket win for England against India in the first Test at Headingley.

item.title: Root reaches 50 to edge England closer to victory in first India Test
item.description: Joe Root reaches his half-century with a boundary to edge England closer to victory against India in the first Test at Headingley.

item.title: 'Can you believe it?' - Duckett dismissed on 149
item.description: Ben Duckett falls for 149, leaving England on 253-3 and needing another 118 runs to beat India in the first Test at Headingley.

item.title: 'It meant a lot to me' - Raducanu emotional after beating Li
item.description: British number one Emma Raducanu says she feels "incredible", after beating Ann Li 6-7 (5-7) 6-3 6-1 at Eastbourne.

item.title: Murray confident in Wimbledon's 'attention to detail' for new statue
item.description: Two-time Wimbledon champion Sir Andy Murray says he is confident in Wimbledon's "attention to detail" for the statue that The All England Club is set to recognise him with.

item.title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
item.description: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

item.title: 'Southern hemisphere' Lions deserve their place - Russell
item.description: The British and Irish Lions players have rallied around their foreign-born team-mates, after Australia coach Joe Schmidt highlighted the ancestry of some of the tourists' squad.

item.title: Chelsea's Jackson given two-game ban for red card
item.description: Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson is given a two-match ban for his red card in Friday's 3-1 Club World Cup defeat by Flamengo.

item.title: Which drivers are in danger of losing their seat for 2026?
item.description: BBC Sport F1 correspondent Andrew Benson answers your latest questions before the Austrian Grand Prix.

item.title: How Draper became a genuine Wimbledon contender
item.description: Grand Slam semi-finalist, Masters champion and a top-five player - Britain's Jack Draper is a different beast on his Wimbledon return.

item.title: 'Impossible to train' - Chelsea face record heat in Philadelphia
item.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says his players are finding it "impossible" to train amid a heatwave on the east coast of the United States.

item.title: Middlesbrough appoint ex-Luton boss Edwards
item.description: Middlesbrough appoint ex-Luton Town manager Rob Edwards to replace Michael Carrick, who was sacked earlier this month after nearly three years in charge.

item.title: Who is Gout Gout? Meet the sprinting sensation compared to Bolt
item.description: BBC Sport profiles athletics' new sprinting sensation who makes his international senior debut at the Golden Spike meet in Ostrava on Tuesday.

item.title: Man Utd draw PSV Eindhoven in Women's Champions League
item.description: Manchester United women will face Dutch side PSV Eindhoven in the second round Champions League qualifying.

item.title: Releasing all Wallabies stars 'counter-productive' - Schmidt
item.description: Australia head coach Joe Schmidt rejects claims from the Lions camp that he must release all his top players to their Super Rugby sides for warm-up games.

item.title: Wimbledon hope to have Murray statue ready by 2027
item.description: The All England Club is set to honour a promise to construct a statue of Sir Andy Murray at Wimbledon and hope to unveil it in 2027.

item.title: Which young players could light up Euro 2025?
item.description: BBC Sport selects the young players to watch at the 2025 Women's European Championships.

item.title: How it stands in Club World Cup group stage - and who needs what?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at who has qualified for the Club World Cup knockout stages already, and who needs what in the final group games.

item.title: Hearts expect Shankland decision 'within days'
item.description: Heart of Midlothian head coach Derek McInnes believes there will be "clarity" over the future of captain Lawrence Shankland "in the coming days", with the Edinburgh club prepared for him either remaining or leaving.

item.title: How did Archer fare on his red-ball return?
item.description: Fast bowler Jofra Archer shows encouraging signs while making his first first-class appearance for four years for Sussex against Durham.

item.title: Fachie announces Para-cycling retirement
item.description: Two-time Paralympic cycling champion Lora Fachie announces her retirement from the sport after 15 years.

item.title: 'Best ever' Jones did not 'duck' Aspinall - Topuria
item.description: Former UFC heavyweight champion Jon Jones did not retire to avoid fighting Britain's Tom Aspinall, says Ilia Topuria.

item.title: Pacers' Haliburton could miss all of 2025-26 season
item.description: Indiana Pacers superstar Tyrese Haliburton could be out for the entire 2025-26 NBA season as he tears his right Achilles tendon.

item.title: Wheeler wants to 'follow in Rose's footsteps'
item.description: Golfer Rob Wheeler hopes to emulate fellow North Hants club member Justin Rose after qualifying for The Open's final qualifying stage.

item.title: Hibs and Glasgow learn Women's Champions League opponents
item.description: SWPL champions Hibernian will face Danish title winners Fortuna Hjorring in the second round of Women's Champions League qualifying, while Glasgow City take on Austria Vienna.

item.title: Mullin's Wrexham journey - timeline of a cult hero
item.description: There is a sense of an end of an era following Wrexham talisman Paul Mullin's move to Wigan Athletic on loan - this is the four year journey of a folk hero.

item.title: 'Out of nowhere!' - Crawley caught for 65 as India finally make breakthrough
item.description: Zak Crawley is caught for 65 as India finally break England's opening partnership, leaving the home side 188-1, chasing 371 for victory in the opening Test at Headingley.

item.title: 'Remarkable' Duckett innings puts England on course for victory
item.description: Ben Duckett hits 149 runs off 170 balls, including 21 fours and a six, to put England on course to chase down 371 to win the first Test against India at Headingley.

item.title: Raducanu fights back to reach Eastbourne second round
item.description: An emotional Emma Raducanu comes back from one set down to beat Ann Li 6-7 (5-7) 6-3 6-1 and reach the second round of Eastbourne.

item.title: Crawley survives after being dropped by Bumrah on 42
item.description: England's Zak Crawley survives a scare on the opening morning of the final day at Headingley after being dropped by India's Jasprit Bumrah on 42, with England 112-0, chasing 371 to win the first Test.

item.title: 'Just speak to someone' - Pimblett's mental health advice
item.description: UFC star Paddy Pimblett speaks with BBC Sport's Sam Harris about dealing with mental health issues.

item.title: How Earps gives 'big sister' energy to Toone & Russo
item.description: Former Manchester United and England team-mates Ella Toone, Alessia Russo and Mary Earps discuss how their friendship blossomed into a "sisterly bond".

item.title: England must follow India example to have chance of win - Vaughan
item.description: BBC Sport pundit Michael Vaughan believes England's tactics in the morning session on the final day will decide whether they win the first Test against India at Headingley, with Ben Stokes' side needing 350 more to win, with all 10 wickets in hand.

item.title: Who is the most iconic British & Irish Lion of all time?
item.description: In a new podcast series on BBC Sounds, former Lions Matt Dawson and Jamie Roberts join the BBC's rugby union correspondent Chris Jones to rank a number of Lions tour topics. Here are their picks for the top 10 Lions icons.

item.title: Wimbledon 'did amazing job' over stalker - Raducanu
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu praises Wimbledon for doing "an amazing job" to prevent a man who had been stalking her from buying tickets to the tournament.

item.title: Pant given demerit point for dissent towards umpires
item.description: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant is give a demerit point after he admits showing dissent towards the umpires during the first Test with England.

item.title: Sampdoria stay up after play-off postponed due to fan unrest
item.description: Sampdoria will remain in Serie B after the league awards them a 3–0 win over Salernitana following the postponement of Sunday's second leg relegation play-off.

item.title: How 'Madiba Magic' inspired Springboks to World Cup glory
item.description: Former players reflect on Nelson Mandela's inspirational role in South Africa's first Rugby World Cup triumph 30 years ago.

item.title: 'It's still a chance to work with him' - Borthwick on Feyi-Waboso pick
item.description: Wing Immanuel Feyi-Waboso will go on tour with England this summer despite being suspended for the two-Test series against Argentina.

item.title: What will Rangers' £20m rebuild look like?
item.description: BBC Scotland looks at the key questions following the Ibrox club's £20m funding being approved on Monday.

item.title: Duckett leads England to classic defeat of India
item.description: Ben Duckett's magnificent 149 leads England to chase down 371 and beat India by five wickets in a thrilling final day of the first Test at Headingley.

item.title: Ex-Swans boss Williams earning 'honest buck' at airport
item.description: For a while at least, former Swansea City boss Luke Williams has swapped the managerial merry-go-round for the airport carousel.

item.title: Irwin to have surgery on pelvic region after crash
item.description: British Superbike rider Glenn Irwin is to undergo surgery on his pelvic region on Thursday after crashing during free practice for last weekend's meeting at Snetterton.

item.title: Fleetwood's stumble gives US Bradley-sized Ryder Cup headache
item.description: As Tommy Fleetwood continues to wrestle with how to get over the winning line on the PGA Tour, American golf is trying to fathom how having a playing captain might work at this year's Ryder Cup, writes Iain Carter.

item.title: The Welsh Way - Inside the 'Harvard of coaching'
item.description: BBC Sport goes behind the scenes at the coaching course which counts Thierry Henry and Mikel Arteta as graduates, and is shaping stars of the future.

item.title: 'Chelsea project excited me' - Delap on why he joined Blues
item.description: New Chelsea signing Liam Delap chose a move to Stamford Bridge instead of other Premier League clubs because the project "excites" him.

item.title: Why Queen's champion Alcaraz is 'red-hot favourite' for Wimbledon
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz arrived in London with "no expectations" but, with Wimbledon only eight days away, he has sent an ominous message to his rivals.

item.title: What do you remember about the 2013 Lions tour?
item.description: How much do you remember of the last British and Irish Lions tour down under? Test your knowledge with our quiz.

item.title: Why Bumrah is most complete fast bowler ever - Finn
item.description: Former England bowler Steven Finn explains why India superstar Jasprit Bumrah is the most complete fast bowler of all time after he takes 5-83 in the first Test.

item.title: Vardy, Eriksen, Young - the free agents available
item.description: The summer transfer window is in full swing but who are the experienced Premier League players out of contract and available on a free transfer on 1 July?

item.title: How Hampton overcame odds to become England's number one
item.description: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.

item.title: The runner who went viral and sparked campaign for change
item.description: When a photo of ultrarunner Sophie Power breastfeeding during a race went viral, it sparked a campaign for change.

item.title: How rejection fuelled Mourinho's second Champions League triumph
item.description: How Barcelona rejection fuelled Jose Mourinho's second Champions League triumph, with Inter Milan in 2010.

item.title: The life, loss and legacy of Kevin Campbell
item.description: Wayne Rooney, Andrew Cole, Tyrese Campbell and more discuss the life and tragic death of former Arsenal and Everton striker Kevin Campbell.

item.title: Blood brothers - bonds and betrayal on a rugby pitch
item.description: Tom Williams was part of a conspiracy that united and then divided a Harlequins dressing room, before the truth rocked rugby to its core.

item.title: I was effectively homeless after getting sacked - Stoney
item.description: Former England captain Casey Stoney tells BBC Sport how she and her family have rebuilt their lives after her sacking by San Diego Wave left them effectively homeless.

item.title: 'I signed Barcelona deal - then had a stroke at 24'
item.description: Goalkeeper Ellie Roebuck suffered a stroke six months after being part of the England squad which reached the World Cup final - this is the story of her remarkable comeback.
